sentence: Sandeep Mahindroo
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Thanks Inba.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Hello everyone and welcome to Infosys Earnings Call to discuss Q1 2023 Financial Results.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: This is Sandeep from the Investor Relations team in Bangalore.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Joining us today on this call is CEO and MD, Mr. Salil Parekh; CFO, Mr. Nilanjan Roy; and other members of the senior management team.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We will commence the call with some remarks on the performance of the company by Salil and Nilanjan.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Subsequent to which, we will open up the call for questions.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Please note that anything that we say that refers to our outlook for the future is a forward-looking statement that must be read in conjunction with the risks that the company faces.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: A full statement and explanation of these risks is available in our filings with the SEC, which can be found on www.sec.gov.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: I would now like to pass on the call to Salil.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy morning.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We had a strong start of FY2023 with a robust year-on-year growth of 21.4% in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: All our business segments and major geos recorded double-digit growth with manufacturing, communication and EURS along with Europe region recording 25% plus growth.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Sequentially, revenue growth was 5.5% which was led by a healthy volume growth and some RPP benefits.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Digital revenues now constitute 61% of total and grew by 37.5% in constant currency.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Client metrics were strong with increase in client counts across revenue buckets compared to the previous year.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Number of $50 mn clients increased by 10 to 69 creating the next potential centurions.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Number of $100 mn clients increased by 4 to 38 and the number of $200 mn clients have grown by 6 in the last one year.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: This reflects our ability to deepen mining across our large clients.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We had another quarter of strong employee additions with over 21,000 to cater to the growth opportunities ahead.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The fresher addition was particularly strong which resulted in drop in utilization to 84.7%.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Onsite effort mix inched up to 24.3%.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Voluntary LTM attrition increased marginally to 28.4%.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Quarterly annualized attrition declined another by 1% from Q4 levels despite Q1 usually seeing an uptick due to seasonality.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: As announced earlier we have given competitive salary increases for majority of employees from April.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Given the supply tightness and high prevailing inflation, salary increases across all geos this year are higher than historical levels.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The increases vary based on job levels and performance of employees with top performers getting double-digit hikes.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Salary hike for other employees is being done effective 1st July.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Q1 margin stood at 20%, a drop of 150 basis points versus previous quarter.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: The major components of the sequential margin movements were as below: Headwinds of - 1.6% due to salary increases, - 0.4% due to drop in utilization as we create capacity for future, - 0.3% due to increases in subcon, third party and other costs.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: These were offset by tailwinds of - 0.5% due to increase in RPP from higher working days, a reversal of a client's contractual provision in our FS segment partially offset by discounts.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: - 0.3% benefits from rupee depreciation benefits partially offset by cross-currency headwinds.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Q1 EPS grew by 4.4% in rupee terms on a year-on-year basis.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our balance sheet continues to be strong and debt-free.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Consolidated cash and investments were 4.4 bn at the end of the quarter after returning more than $850 mn to the shareholders through dividends.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: This has led to increase in ROE to 31%.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Free cash flow for the quarter was $656 mn which is a conversion of 95% of net profits.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Yield on cash balance remained stable at 5.3% in Q1.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: DSO declined by 4 days sequentially to 63.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: DSO including net unbilled was 82 days an increase of 1 day versus Q4.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Coming to segmental performance: We signed 19 large deals in Q1 with a TCV of $1.69 bn.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: This comprises of the 50% net new.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We have signed 5 large deals in retail and CPG, 4 in Hi-Tech, 3 each in financial services and energy utility resources and services and 2 each in manufacturing and communications verticals.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Region- wise 15 were in Americas and 2 each in Europe and RoW.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: In Financial Services clients continue to focus on digital customer experience, contact center transformation and virtual branches aimed at improving customer engagement.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: While the order pipeline remains strong across regions, we are seeing some slowness in mortgage industry and lending business due to increased interest rates.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: We remain watchful of impacts of emerging global developments on budget for clients.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: In the retail segment the pace of Digital transformation large-scale cost breakouts and improving business resilience continues to be on the rise across various subsegments.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Our focus on proactive engagement has helped us in creating a robust pipeline.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Clients are monitoring the emerging macro situation and the impact of that on their business.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: In communications segment clients are focused on rapid digitization and protecting their assets from cyber threats, we see enormous potential to partner with them both on the digital transformation agenda as well as in the cost takeout front.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Deal pipeline in energies, utilities, resources and services segments comprises of opportunities around cost takeouts, vendor consolidation, digital transformation, cloud-led transformation and asset monetization across industry sub-verticals.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Manufacturing segment is seeing broad-based growth across geographies and industry sub- verticals.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The sector has seen traction across energy, IoT, supply chain, cloud ERP and accelerated cloud adoption.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: In Q1 we have been ranked as leader in 9 ratings in the areas of Oracle Cloud, SAP S/4HANA, Public Cloud, Industry 4.0, employee experience and automation services.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: In this supply constrained environment, we continue to invest in our growth momentum which requires us to hire premium, skill talent while simultaneously investing in existing employees through competitive compensation increases across geos.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Additionally, we expect normalization of costs like travel and other overheads.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We will continue to focus on various cost optimization measures including rationalization of subcons, flattening of the pyramid, increasing automation, reducing onsite mix and increasing pricing.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Whilst we retain our operating margin guidance of 21% to 23%, we expect to be at the bottom end of the range.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: The revenue guidance for the year has been revised to 14% to 16% from 13% to 15% earlier.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: With that we can open the call for questions.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Surendra Goyal Thanks for that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Good morning just a couple of questions from my side.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Firstly a clarification.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan, I believe you said that the contractual provision was largely offset by discounts.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Could you please clarify a bit.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Did you mean discounts to the same client or discounts in general?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Curious because on one hand we are talking of a strong demand environment and potential price hikes and at the same time we are also talking of discounts?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy The comment was 0.5% increase in RPP is a combination of three to four elements â€“ higher working days, the client contraction provision reversal benefits partially offset by discount.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So it is not a direct linkage of discounts and client contractual provisions.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: It is not to the same client.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: These are generic discounts and these automatically keep on coming.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: But, like I said discounts have come down as we have started negotiating with our clients in terms of pricing but that is the net impact of all these.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Surendra Goyal Just another question on margin down 360 bps year-over-year, operating profit growth Y-o-Y is worse in historical trends despite all the strong demand and growth we are talking about.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: So if you just think about this 360 basis point decline, how much of that is really investment which you think can be recouped as we go forward from here?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy When we were 360 bps down, we knew we were having some benefits in a way - our utilization was very high it was 88%, we have never operated at that level before, the benefits of travel etc.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Now we are seeing more and more of that has been coming back.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So that is something which we were well aware of in last year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: But as we see the demand volume ahead, I think we are very clear that in terms of our ability to support this demand first we have to hire, we have to pay competitively.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So we actually did two wage hikes in calendar year 2021 and now this year we have already rolled out in April.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So within one and a half year we have done three substantial CRs and actually in September last year also we did a skill based increase.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So we have been continuously investing behind that and we know that to capitalize this demand we have to pay for premium skills.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have to go behind the volume.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Comparing subcontractor costs - perhaps from an industry leading 6.5% position we are closer to 11% now, but again these are something we know over a period of time we have a lot of optimization levers.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We do not want to leave a five-year demand on the table because of short-term cost pressures and these we can optimize over this year and over the future as well.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So in that sense we are quite confident and that is why we have talked about 21% to 23% range and we will be at the bottom end of the range.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Of course if we are 20% today, we will see that improvement as the year progresses.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Surendra Goyal Sure thanks for that I will get back in the queue.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Moshe Katri Thanks.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Spectacular numbers especially on revenues side of the business.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Just a follow-up to the last topic or question about margins.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are getting a lot of pushbacks on that.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: From your perspective looking at the levers that you highlighted, what do you think is the biggest potential lever here for you to be able to catch up to the margin range that you mentioned and then I have a follow-up after that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy Firstly if you see, how our margin profile, has changed, so one, of course has been this utilization and in fact, 21,000+ net adds during the quarter which is well above our volumes and that is to create the buffer.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So when we put in freshers, we train them and then over a period of time, we are able to put them into production.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So you cannot just have higher freshers and expect them to start contributing from day 1.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are very vigilant about that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: They go through mandatory training in Myosre, and then we put them into projects.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So that is one big part of where we think we can start improving.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: As the hiring catches up automatically, you will see the stabilization of subcon costs, which as percentage of revenue, you are seeing this increase every quarter.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: While we have seen it flattening out and over the future, as we got our recruitments done and we are able to hire fresher, we should see benefits coming out of that.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Pyramid benefits will continue to happen for us.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: While we are seeing some adverse impact from the onsite movement, this is largely as travel overseas starts, but we think this is more of a aberration in terms of uptick, because the inherent story of taking cost out and having a more offshore mix in the entire cost optimization will come into benefits especially in this environment where cost take out is becoming a big theme across our clients.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So, we know we can have multiple areas.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Pricing is another thing, which we have been talking about.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We have seen less impact of discounts, etc., we are going back to clients in terms of COLA adjustments at the time of renewals.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Now these are much more longer-term impact decisions, but I think at least the conversations have started in right direction across all the segments and you can hear similar commentary across.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So I think these are the areas we continue to focus on and are something we have done over the years.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We continue to be very forceful in terms of our cost efficiency exercises.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Moshe Katri Just as a follow-up, just remind us what is the sensitivity for margins versus utilization rates i.e., 100 basis points expansion in utilization rates what does it mean to margins in terms of sensitivity?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Thank you.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy Yes, so I think it depends on by which levels we see utilization.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, it is quite complicated if you have a different utilization in onsite, different in offshore and then the impact of the freshers in the pyramid in that utilization.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, it is a bit complicated how the mix changes.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: I just cannot give you off the cuff number of what 1% will lead to, but to give you the impact in this quarter, 40 basis points because of utilization on margins.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Moshe Katri All right thanks for the color.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Kumar Rakesh Good morning.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Thank you for taking my question.

label: POSITIVE

label: POSITIVE

sentence: So these are the things which can play in our favour.

sentence: You have seen these numbers of decline pretty much across industries.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: I think we have a very, very sharp cost optimization program in a way which will go and offset these headwinds.

sentence: Kumar Rakesh Got it.

sentence: So it appears the supply side pressure was higher than what we were earlier expecting.

label: POSITIVE

sentence: So that is the second area that it benefits us.

label: NEGATIVE

sentence: That is a segment which we feel is a strong segment for the future and where in our view underweight in percentage terms.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So we want to enhance that with these existing capabilities.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Kumar Rakesh Got it thanks a lot for that Salil.

sentence: Keith Bachman Thank you very much.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: My first question is I wanted to get your views on how you think wage inflation will impact the balance of the year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: And what are the tensions on that to your margin model?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So you mentioned that attrition has in fact moved lower, do you think attrition continues to move lower and how do you think wage inflation will unfold over the next about three, four quarters and be a force in the gross margin equation and then will follow up?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy I think like we started last year we were very clear that we have to be competitive in the market.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So, we did the first hike in January of 2021 then we did the next hike in July of 2021 then we did a follow-up on our talent in September of 2021.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: In a way, we have not waited one year we have actually gone ahead and done our majority of our wage hike from 1st of April this year.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Increase for middle to higher level to senior force will happen in July but not the same margin impact of quarter one which was very broad based.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Other than that, I think these are quite competitive and of course if you see in the mix, we also get a lot of laterals where there is a hidden cost of hiring because they come at stretches.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So in a way, your overall weighted average compensation in any case is going up across.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: I think overall this is a very competitive hike.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: In India it is more like high single digits and in overseas geos because of high wage inflation across we have given very competitive hikes.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: This is something which we have not done before.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So these are very much higher than what we did in the past.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: But we think this is something which is going to stand up in good stead in terms of attrition and we have seen three quarters of the attrition benefits and expect it to continue.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Keith Bachman We cover a number of software companies and software companies have started to say they are seeing pockets of weakness with demand elongation on sales cycles.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: It does not sound like we made one very specific industry comment but it does not sound like you are seeing the same any kind of iteration on the demand side particularly on the negative side, but if you could just clarify, are you seeing any elongation on the new business front, yes or no, and if the macro does weaken will that in fact help your wage situation and that is it from me.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Thank you.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Salil Parekh Thanks for that.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: A couple of points that you raised, I think what we see on the demand, the pipeline that we have today for our large deals is larger than what we had three or six months ago.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Having said that, we of course recognize what is going on in the global environment and we mentioned a couple of areas.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan talked within retail, he also mentioned within Financial Services - mortgages.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So we see pockets where we see some impact.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: On the overall deal discussions we see a little bit where it is slowing in the decision making; however, the pipeline remains strong for us today.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: We have also get two types of deals, one is deals which are on digital transformation or cloud which are growth orientated for clients driving to what they want to do with their customers in their supply chain, how they want to make an impact.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: The second is on cost, we have a very strong play on cost and efficiency through our automation work, through our artificial intelligence work where we can really impact the cost base in the tech landscape of our clients.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So those are areas which we are already very active within this environment and given our positioning we feel good that those will start to come into play as and when the environment changes.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: But today this is how we are seeing the demand situation.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Now your other question was will that have a change on the wage if the macro evolving.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We do not have a clear view on where that will go because it is a function of how the macro evolves and what happens.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Of course, we are seeing attrition starting to come off a little bit and that will clearly have a positive impact for us with respect to compensation.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So the timeline is not clear, it depends on how the macro evolves.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Keith Bachman Okay great many thanks.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nitin Padmanabhan Good morning.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Thanks for the opportunity.

label: POSITIVE

label: NEGATIVE

sentence: There is no way we said that has it been eroded, we have caught the benefit of client contractual provisions clearly.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: The other one on visa, travel - I think they largely offset each other.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: On the outlook on wages, we have done it for most of our employees, it is up to mid level.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: For more of the senior levels is what we are going to roll out in July and that impact would be far less than 1.6% which we have done which is a much more broad based for us.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nitin Padmanabhan Both associates and mid level happen this quarter itself.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: It is not only associate.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy Yes, associates and mid level, correct.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nitin Padmanabhan Correct that is very helpful.

sentence: Thank you so much.

sentence: Bryan Bergin Thanks for taking the question.

sentence: So I heard you mentioned mortgages, mentioned subcomponent of retail.

label: POSITIVE

sentence: Salil Parekh Thanks for your question.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: This is Salil.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: We are now seeing pockets, this is not across our whole business.

sentence: Bryan Bergin Okay and then just a follow-up on margin.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: You gave sequential changes can you give us what the year-on-year changes in operating margin with the different categories?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Nilanjan Roy So largely we know it was the comp related hike that is near only about 370 basis points that was the biggest one and there were some rupee benefits offset by both cross currency as well and then we got some benefits of cost optimization, we got some hits on lower utilization.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So these are the broad things but the biggest one was the comp which was about 370 basis points.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Bryan Bergin Alright thank you.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Sudheer Guntupalli Good morning gentlemen.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Thanks for giving me this opportunity.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: I have just one question on margins.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Ideally the strong growth at the headline level should have translated into some operating leverage, but that does not seem to be happening and Nilanjan we seem to be of the view, we will chase growth for now and focus on margin optimization at a later date.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: What is the risk to that hypothesis because this growth margin paradox seem to be a mere reflection of what is happening in U.S. and U.K. now a very tight job market, very high nominal growth, but very little benefit trickling down to the bottomline level.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So sooner or later this nominal growth rates may cool off and onsite job markets and some supply costs may auto recalibrate.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: But back in India job market may not be as much of a free market as it is in U.K. and U.S. there may be some sticky elements both at headcount and wage level translating into negative operating leverage as demand moderates.
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: So what is the risk that margins will remain structurally lower than even the pre-COVID levels going ahead because demand tends to be more cyclical while some of these supply costs tend to be more sticky?
label: NEUTRAL

sentence: Nilanjan Roy There are a couple of things.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: See one is that many of these cost increases cannot be passed on the client on day one.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: If I have to give a wage hike on all my existing base they will come up for renewals that is the time when you have a wage discussion.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: When you are doing new deal, automatically we will build it and the industry in a way will build it into their wage profile.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So these things will automatically flow back, there is no free lunch for anybody.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So that is one thing which will happen over a period of time, but that is more of a generic point I am making.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: But in terms of subcons, we have operated at 6%-6.5% of subcon; today we are sitting at 11.3%, there is no reason for us to be at these levels unless we know what the job market is.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: In the overall demand environment, when our recruiting picks up we can replace these subcons with our own headcount, put more freshers into projects and this is something we have been doing very well in the past as well.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: So I think these levers are well known for us, we know how utilization works, our pyramid works, so we are quite confident in the forward model of taking out cost from our overall structure.
label: NEGATIVE

sentence: Sudheer Guntupalli Just one more question if I may.
label: POSITIVE

sentence: So when we say the pipeline is larger now, just curious if the pipeline is getting bigger and bigger because some of the decision making is getting slower, is there any correlation you read in between the two?
label: POSITIVE

sentence: Salil Parekh The pipeline what we are seeing is there is appetite and you go by different industry for Digital transformation programs, for large cloud programs, for programs which start to relate to cost and efficiency, that is what is in the pipeline.
label: POSITIVE
